thread.title: What they're saying in Tennessee, nationally after Alabama beats Vols
thread.title_full: What they're saying in Tennessee, nationally after Alabama beats Vols | AL.com

author: Michael Casagrande | mcasagrande@al.com
title: What they're saying in Tennessee, nationally after Alabama beats Vols
text:
It was another wild ride in Bryant-Denny Stadium, but Alabama survived a scare from Tennessee .
There was plenty to read from the Crimson Tide perspective at AL.com , so take a look at what's being said in Tennessee and beyond:
-- Adams: tough finish not as hard to stomach (Knoxville News-Sentinel)
-- Vols take lead in fourth, but can't beat Alabama (Knoxville News-Sentinel)
-- Vols show progress despite loss (Tennessean)
-- Alvin Kamara's return to Tuscaloosa is emotional (Tennessean)
-- Vols' loss to Alabama adds another close call to season (Tennessean)
-- Wiedmer: UT better, but Bama still best (Chattanooga Times Free Press)
-- Vols vow 'win together, lose together' (Chattanooga Times Free Press)
-- Alabama survives close call from Vols, wins 19-14 (Chattanooga Times Free Press)
-- Butch Jones: No 'moral victories' in close loss to Tide (247Sports)
-- Kamara: Vols lost to Bama in 'game of equals' (247Sports)
A few from the national outlets ...
-- Instant Analysis: Alabama outlasts Tennessee, keeps playoff hopes alive (Sports Illustrated)
-- Alabama's playoff stock continues roller-coaster ride against Tennessee (ESPN)
-- No. 8 Alabama edges Tennessee 19-14: Three things to know (CBS Sports)
And the view from Tuscaloosa and Kevin Scarbinsky
-- Alabama survives a close encounter with Tennessee to brace the house for LSU
